text:
@SupraDarky I started out with Alundra 2 and it's actually a pretty good game. It isn't as good as Alundra 1, but it still is a lot of fun and nostalgia for me :)
It also has some kick ass music, just listen to the main menu theme :D

author: Amiiix

text: @Cawesome69 Main character is a "dreamwalker" and can travel into peoples dreams, he gets ship wrecked on an island where the natives are having dreams they never wake from queue you.  The story can't be given the accolade it deserves so briefly so i suggest giving it a try
author: maverickmic

text: @SupraDarky Whatever you do don't go in expecting the same level of quality and depth as the original at least that way you shouldn't be as disappointed :)
author: maverickmic

text:
Finally!
This, in my opinion, is one of the best songs from the Alundra OST. So ethereal.
Alundra was a very special game. Perfect control, amazing environments and challenging puzzles with a surprisingly dark and deep story.
My favorite type of game.

author: MeSako

text: yea, got this game when it came out on the psn store for $6 and i can't say no to these sorts of games and yea, it controls like a zelda game, but plays much differently to a zelda game. it's less fighting oriented and more puzzle. also, there's a jump button. lots of people to talk to in towns to solve puzzles and find secrets and you go into people's dreams to heal them or fight monsters. some puzzles are AMAZINGLY DIFFICULT. great game if you're patient and enjoy ps1/snes graphics.
